channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Cherokee Nation Requests That Jeep Drop Cherokee Name
item.description: the US auto industry has a long history of using Native American monikers and imagery. ¬†Chief Chuck Hoskin Jr. requested that Jeep stop using his tribe's name on its Cherokee and Grand Cherokee SUVs, which together account for more than 40% of the brand's total sales.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Trump Taxes: Supreme Court Allows Manhattan DA to Subpoena Financial Documents
item.description: Yesterday, the nation's highest court blocked former President Trump from keeping his financial records out of the hands of Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr.¬†The details of Vance's investigation into alleged tax, insurance, and bank fraud by the Trump Organization (which includes residential and commercial real estate) haven't been made public.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: The Week Ahead: February 22
item.description: Let us know if you've got any fun costumes planned. On Thursday, Airbnb and DoorDash will deliver their first earnings reports since going public. Chag sameach to our Jewish readers celebrating Purim Thursday night. ¬†Warren Buffett will release his famous annual shareholder letter on Saturday.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Coinbase, Stripe Valued Above $100B
item.description: ¬† As the first US-based crypto exchange to go public, it'll also confer major legitimacy to digital currencies. ¬†First up, CoinbaseAhead of its planned direct listing, investors are valuing Coinbase at $100+ billion, which would make it the biggest US tech listing since Facebook, per Axios.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: February 22
item.description: (New York Times) Read: A financial crisis is heading for the legendary soccer club, Barcelona. For once, though, his tweets went ignored: Both cryptocurrencies hit record highs this weekend.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Some Texans Face Exorbitant Electricity Bills Following Energy Crisis
item.description: Many Texans facing exorbitant charges were customers of power supplier Griddy, whose prices fluctuate with the wholesale energy market. ¬† And Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner said the state of Texas should "bear the responsibility" of paying the egregiously high bills.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Economic Data Points to Positive Economic Recovery
item.description: ¬†The growing signs for optimismWhen investors are nervous about what's ahead, they typically buy US Treasury bonds, which sends bond prices higher and yields down. ¬†Still, the latest wave of economic data has some experts hoping that the US is not only on the rebound, but ahead of schedule. Retail sales jumped 5.3% in January, aided by the latest round of stimulus checks. And when he testifies to the Senate and House finance committees this week, Fed Chair Jerome Powell is expected to continue pressing for more action.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: It is Snowing in Hawaii
item.description: ü§ô ¬†+ Of course they have: Some locals have swapped their surfboards to snowboards to shred what they‚Äôre calling ‚Äúpineapple powder.‚Äù
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Roku Breaks Records In Its Q4 Earnings Report
item.description: As people filled their 2020 voids with CW dramas, Roku‚Äôs users streamed 10% more per day in the fourth quarter of 2020 than they did in Q4 2019. It‚Äôs now on the lookout for more content to acquire, or even create some original programming of its own.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Covid Vaccine Tracker
item.description: ¬†One dose to rule them all: A peer-reviewed study conducted in Israel found that Pfizer‚Äôs vaccine is at least 85% effective after the first of two doses. 6.47 million doses are being administered daily, on average. 193 million doses have been administered in 87 different countries.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Marriott CEO Arne Sorenson Passes Away
item.description: The $42 billion company he leaves behind will name a successor by the end of the month. ¬†During his tenure, Marriott's stock rose over 240%. Sorenson also used his position to speak out on issues around immigration and LGBTQ discrimination.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Snowstorm Unexpectedly Freezes Some US Businesses
item.description: ¬† A fearsome storm continued to roll through the south and central US yesterday, leaving millions of households without power in bone-chilling temperatures. Some authorities in Texas had to rush doses into people‚Äôs arms before they spoiled.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: WTO Appoints Ngozi Okonjo-Iwealea as Director-General
item.description: Yesterday, she was selected as the new WTO director-general. the WTO needs its court running. Okonjo-Iweala wants to reform the WTO to win back respect, promote fair trade, and help with the pandemic recovery. When she starts her 4.5-year term at the WTO next month, she'll be the first woman, African, and (a dual citizen since 2019) American to head the organization.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Mother Nature Unleashes Texas-Sized Storm on the South
item.description: And as huge as Texas is, this storm is bigger than just one state. A winter storm is pummeling the South, leaving millions without power and causing mayhem in the energy market. Texas is a powerhouse for fossil fuels, not renewable energy." But wind power is actually the fastest-growing source of energy in the state's power grid. 3+ million barrels/day in output have been taken offline, more than half of the 5.8 million barrels/day typically produced in the Permian region of Texas and New Mexico. ¬†¬†
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: L‚ÄôOr√©al Has Strong Q4, Says 2021 Looks Promising
item.description: The next years will ‚Äúbe like the Roaring 20s, there will be a fiesta in makeup and in fragrances,‚Äù L‚ÄôOr√©al CEO and Chairman Jean-Paul Agon predicted when discussing the company's results. Well, actually, more like e-commerce in China.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Meet the Air Taxi Startup Going Public via SPAC
item.description: ¬† Yesterday, electric aircraft startup Archer said it will SPAC into the public markets in a deal that values it at $3.8 billion. SPACs, or special purpose acquisition companies, have raised more than $38 billion so far this year.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: UAE Satellite Enters Mars Orbit: What It Means
item.description: ¬† ¬†The nifty science-museum details: From its equatorial orbit, the UAE's satellite will scan the entire surface of Mars every nine days, per mission officials.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Kirkland & Ellis's 2020 Was Reportedly Its Best Year Yet
item.description: If you're on the lookout for more pandemic winners, may we point you to Big Law. The world's highest-grossing law firm, Kirkland & Ellis, is on track to post record annual revenue of ~$5 billion for the 12 months ending in January, according to the Financial Times.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Photos of Vaccination Throughout History
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: How to File Your Taxes as a Sole Proprietor
item.description: ¬†First, you‚Äôre gonna have to fill out some forms:¬†Income Tax: 1040 (individual income tax return), including a Schedule C (profit or loss from an unincorporated business)¬†Self-Employment Tax: Schedule SE¬†If you have employees, tack on:¬†Estimated Tax: 1040-ESSocial Security, Medicare, and Income Tax Withholding: 941, 943, 944¬†More Info on Social Security, Medicare, and Income Tax Withholding: W-2, W-3¬†Federal Unemployment (FUTA) Tax: 940¬†You may also need to work through issues like information returns (payments to and transactions with non-employees) and excise taxes (taxes paid on certain goods, like gas). A sole proprietorship is the most DIY of all business structures: Legally speaking, there‚Äôs no difference between you and your biz.
item.author: Devin Tomb

item.title: Vaccine Rollouts Power Uneven Reopening Campaigns Across the World
item.description: ¬†Tier 1: Schools will resume on March 8 and outdoor leisure activities like parks, zoos, golf, and tennis may reopen in April. The US is a little all over the placeNYC upped indoor dining capacity to 35% starting next week and California lawmakers have proposed a $6.6 billion plan to reopen elementary schools by April. The badge gives them access to restaurants, events, and other leisure activities. ¬†Tier 2: The UK‚Äôs pubs and restaurants will probably have to wait until May or early June for a full reopening.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.description: ¬†One dose to rule them all: A peer-reviewed study conducted in Israel found that Pfizer‚Äôs vaccine is at least 85% effective after the first of two doses. 6.47 million doses are being administered daily, on average. 193 million doses have been administered in 87 different countries.

item.title: Roku Breaks Records In Its Q4 Earnings Report
item.description: As people filled their 2020 voids with CW dramas, Roku‚Äôs users streamed 10% more per day in the fourth quarter of 2020 than they did in Q4 2019. It‚Äôs now on the lookout for more content to acquire, or even create some original programming of its own.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Brew Crossword: Pet Projects
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Cathie Wood is the Market‚Äôs New Oracle
item.description: Can Wood and Ark keep it going? ¬†Zoom out: In January last year, Ark had less than $3.5 billion in total assets; Ark Innovation alone has already attracted $5.3 billion in inflows this year. Ark has added 132,000 more shares across three ETFs since Tesla announced it was investing in bitcoin. ¬† ¬†To get a sampling of what sectors Wood is interested in, Ark‚Äôs five actively managed ETFs are:¬†1) Autonomous Technology & Robots2) Next Generation Internet3) Genomic Revolution4) Fintech Innovation5) Innovation, the flagshipEach fund is bursting with companies Ark thinks are developing paradigm-changing technologies. And if you disagree with any of its assessments, Ark publishes the models that support its thinking for free on GitHub.¬†But the rocket fuel to Ark‚Äôs rise is a company that spurns traditional fuel altogether: Tesla. Ark Innovation is up 22% year-to-date, while its other four funds are all in the green.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Key Performance Indicators
item.description: (The Atlantic)¬† Read: The NHL has a huge problem‚Äîits goalies are too big. And in January, traffic at its US shopping centers was more than 99% of last year's levels ü§î.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Walmart Raises Wages, McDonald's Links Exec Pay to Diversity Targets
item.description: Kroger had "hero pay" when the pandemic began, then switched to one-time bonuses of up to $400. Depending on location, wages will bump up to $13‚Äì$19/hour. ¬† The fast food chain wants to improve representation in senior leadership to 45% women and 35% minorities by 2025.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: What's Going on Between Big Tech and Publishers in Australia?
item.description: ¬† A proposed law is winding through Australia's Parliament that would require social platforms like Facebook and Google to make revenue-sharing agreements with publishers. ¬†Publishers' POV: Over the course of the digital revolution, platforms have eaten publishers' lunch, and dinner, and post-dinner snack.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: NASA Rover Touches Down on Mars
item.description: ¬†It has a friend waiting: NASA's Curiosity rover, which landed on Mars in 2012.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Finance Bigwigs, Tech Execs, and a Reddit Investor Testify on Capitol Hill
item.description: ¬† Two Business Casual podcast episodes about GameStop. Griffin denied conspiracy theories that Citadel and Robinhood colluded to limit trading in GameStop. ¬†Tenev and Ken Griffin, the billionaire founder of Citadel, both said that PFOF allows for innovation in the industry, such as the no-commission trades pioneered by Robinhood. ¬†Best of the rest:¬†Reddit‚Äôs CEO said investment advice on the platform is ‚Äúprobably among the best.‚Äù The guests are: 1) Jannick Malling, cofounder and co-CEO of investing social network Public and 2) Neal Freyman, who edits this newsletter every day and has been told he has a "podcast voice."
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: How a Financial Educator Does Her Taxes: ‚ÄúCovid-19 Has Affected the Way I Ask for Help‚Äù
item.description: ¬†Berna Anat: My biggest thing when it comes to taxes is: Always ask a legitimate tax professional. ¬†BA: You know, I tend to be very conservative, like, oh, I don‚Äôt think I should deduct that, or, I don‚Äôt think I deserve that grant... ¬†MB: Yes, talk about how you got into financial education in the first place. ¬†MB: Is Covid-19 going to change anything about the way you‚Äôre doing your taxes this year? It‚Äôs kind of redundant now that we‚Äôre talking about it, but it encompasses everything I do with my P&L and my journaling and it goes into a nice little package that my accountant understands at the end of the year. How did you find your legitimate tax professional? That means I can actually get financially organized. Now that you‚Äôre a profitable entrepreneur, how do you keep track of your expenses leading up to tax season? ¬†I spoke with Berna Anat, who torpedoed out of $50,000 in debt and is now a financial educator, about her approach to taxes. You‚Äôre going to get arrested for the tacos. He explained how most monthly expenses that contribute to your work can be considered write-offs, but to run everything by him so I don‚Äôt get carried away. But also, the more the work grew, the more I became concerned about protecting my personal expenses, which are very important to me because that‚Äôs how I got into this whole journey. Morning Brew: You‚Äôre a financial educator, so how do you educate your community about tax season? He‚Äôs like, "OK, let‚Äôs talk about write-offs." I was paying for a full session and wanted to use my time up to the minute. ¬†So, I think Covid-19 has really affected the way I ask for help, and the way that I consider myself a business. If you‚Äôre getting tacos for a business meeting, that voice is like... ¬†I learned that credit card debt is the most shamey debt, so I started by paying off that $12,000 bill. But my business coach and a bunch of other financial educator friends have encouraged me over the past year by saying as an LLC, you‚Äôre a small business‚Äîand you‚Äôre a woman and a person of color‚Äîand you deserve to go after business grants and loans. Because as an individual, I‚Äôm like, I‚Äôm fine.
item.author: Devin Tomb

item.title: Get to Know the GameStop Hearing‚Äôs Five Key Witnesses
item.description: ¬† ¬†Quote about him: Reddit user reality_czech said, ‚ÄúYour steady hand convinced many of us to not only buy, but hold. Quote from him: Regarding the conspiracy theories that Robinhood was somehow compelled to limit trading by Big Finance, Tenev told Elon Musk on Clubhouse, "There was a rumor that Citadel or other market makers kind of pressured us into doing this and that's just false." ¬†Fun fact: The same week that his deal for a 24,000-square-ft penthouse at 220 Central Park South went through, he also bought a mansion near Buckingham Palace that Charles de Gaulle once lived in. Quote about him: Ellen Pao, the former Reddit CEO, emailed Bloomberg, ‚ÄúReddit should be adding a disclaimer because I don‚Äôt believe all 6 million people in the r/wallstreetbets, and the people who followed them, know exactly what they are getting into. ¬†¬†Fun fact: To the public‚Äôs knowledge, Plotkin has no social media accounts‚Äîwhich might be a good thing once you peep around Reddit forums like r/MelvinCapitalLove a little. Today at noon ET, the House Financial Services Committee will get 5 guys. In other words, regulators will want to know if he lied about being bullish on GameStop stock to boost its price for his own profit. Gabe Plotkin¬† Gabe Plotkin Net worth: $300 million, as of April 2018What he does: Founder of the hedge fund Melvin Capital. ¬†His role in the GameStop saga: Citadel the market maker made a lot of moola processing trades that sent GameStop stock ‚Äúto the moon.‚Äù Griffin will also probably answer questions surrounding conspiracy theories, such as whether Citadel teamed up with Robinhood to manipulate stock prices in its favor. Quote from him: ‚ÄúPeople were doing a quick take, saying GameStop was the next Blockbuster. Keith Gill aka Roaring Kitty¬†¬†¬† YouTube Net worth: We don‚Äôt know exactly, but what we do know is that his GameStop stake was worth $22 million earlier this month (when shares were slightly higher than they are now). ¬†At the hearing, regulators will attempt to figure out whether market manipulation played a role in last month‚Äôs Reddit-fueled market mania, and whether any other financial rules were broken in the process. ¬†¬†What he does: Founder of Citadel, a company that has a hand in most corners of the financial world. ¬†¬†¬†Quote about him: Steve Cohen, the billionaire investor whose company Point72 agreed to invest $750 million in Melvin alongside Citadel, said in a statement: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve known Gabe Plotkin since 2006 and he is an exceptional investor and leader.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: USPS Data Shows San Francisco Exodus‚Äîto Other Bay Area Counties
item.description: ¬† US Postal Service data shows that San Fran residents are indeed leaving the city in droves‚Äîfor other Bay Area counties including Alameda, San Mateo, and Marin.
item.author: Eliza Carter
